TITLE: House GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy appears to lack support to become speaker ahead of key vote
SUMMARY: After months of lobbying his fellow Republicans, GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy has failed to secure the 218 votes he needs to become House speaker.

TITLE: Feds launch FTX task force to recover victim assets, continue probes as Bankman-Fried pleads not guilty
SUMMARY: The collapse of crypto exchange FTX led to criminal prosecutions of founder Sam Bankman-Fried and two of his lieutenants in New York federal court.

TITLE: U.S. House adjourns without a speaker after GOP leader Kevin McCarthy falls short in three votes
SUMMARY: After months of lobbying fellow Republicans, GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy failed in three rounds of voting to win the 218 votes he needs to become House speaker.

TITLE: Nonprofit financed by billionaire George Soros quietly donated $140 million to political causes in 2021
SUMMARY: A George Soros backed nonprofit put $140 million into politically charged groups in the buildup to the 2022 midterm elections.

TITLE: Republican leader Kevin McCarthy is about to lose a sixth vote for House speaker
SUMMARY: Republican House leader Rep. Kevin McCarthy appeared no closer Wednesday to securing the 218 votes he needs to be elected speaker.

TITLE: U.S. House adjourns without a speaker after GOP leader McCarthy loses sixth vote
SUMMARY: Republican House leader Rep. Kevin McCarthy failed six times to secure enough votes to be House speaker, leaving his party in disarray.

TITLE: GOP leader McCarthy loses eighth House speaker vote as holdouts accuse him of betrayal
SUMMARY: The absence of a speaker left the House in disarray, largely due to the fact that rank-and-file members can't be sworn into office until a speaker is elected.

TITLE: South Carolina Supreme Court overturns state 6-week abortion ban as unconstitutional
SUMMARY: The ruling by South Carolina's highest court comes more than six months after the U.S. Supreme Court voided the federal right to abortion.

TITLE: Here's how the House speaker debacle is paralyzing the U.S. Congress
SUMMARY: The failure to elect a House speaker has left the legislative branch of the government effectively paralyzed.

TITLE: Biden to visit U.S.-Mexico border city of El Paso on Sunday as White House rolls out new immigration rules
SUMMARY: The trip details came as the administration announced new border enforcement measures related to the anticipated lifting of the Covid-era Title 42 policy.

TITLE: CVS and Walgreens plan to sell abortion pill mifepristone at pharmacies after FDA rule change
SUMMARY: Mifepristone has become a central flashpoint in the political battle over abortion at the state level in the wake of the Supreme Court overturning Roe v. Wade.

TITLE: U.S. House adjourns for third night without a speaker as McCarthy scrambles to find deal with far-right Republicans
SUMMARY: The absence of a speaker left the House in disarray, largely due to the fact that rank-and-file members can't be sworn into office until a speaker is elected.

TITLE: SEC ends insider trading probe of ex-Sen. Richard Burr and brother-in-law without taking action, lawyers say
SUMMARY: The Securities and Exchange Commission was eyeing former Sen. Richard Burr over stock sales before a market crash sparked by the Covid pandemic.

TITLE: U.S. slaps Iran with another round of sanctions over drones used in Russia's war on Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Treasury imposed sanctions on Iran's Qods Aviation Industries, the country's top defense manufacturer, for producing unmanned aerial vehicles.

TITLE: Biden awards Presidential Citizens Medals on two-year anniversary of Jan. 6 Capitol riot
SUMMARY: The ceremony marking the two-year anniversary of the pro-Trump riot was Biden's first time bestowing the Presidential Citizens Medal.

TITLE: U.S. announces $3.8 billion security assistance package for Ukraine, European allies
SUMMARY: The aid package, the 29th such tranche, brings U.S. commitment to Ukraine's fight to about $24.9 billion since the beginning of the Biden administration.
